column4: Hi, I was in a graphical KDE session. Then I used "lock session". I came back later, and entered my password to unlock it. It said "unlocking failed". Then I pressed ctrl+alt+F2 and logged in with my username and the same password. It worked. Then I started a new graphical session, and again there I can login with my password. But I want my original graphical sessoin (which is at ctrl+alt+f7), and it still says "unlocking failed", but I seriousl
what else than a wrong password could cause this "unlocking failed"?
try running "sudo passwd <username> in a term and setting the passwd to what you think it is and retrying
